alert.note: Alert for Coastal Rockingham; Interior Rockingham; Strafford (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 26 at 7:04AM EDT until October 26 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: .Tropical moisture will stream northward into portions of Maine and southeastern NH today. This will aid in the development of rain, heavy at times, especially this afternoon and early evening. Isolated thunderstorms are possible as well. Areas that receive several heavy bands of rain or a slow moving band of rain may experience flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following areas, Androscoggin, Central Interior Cumberland, Coastal Cumberland, Coastal York and Interior York. Portions of New Hampshire, including the following areas, Coastal Rockingham, Interior Rockingham and Strafford. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 7 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas especially in areas that have storm drains blocked by leaves.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
